channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fencing in alleyway needs repair, 15th December
item.description:
The fencing in the alleyway needs to either be reinstated or removed. At present it is the worst of both. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Wateringbury Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge needs resurfacing, 15th December
item.description:

item.title: Unsafe storage/disposal of building material, 15th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dynevor Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Antisocial behaviour caused by youths on skateboards., 15th December
item.description:
The bench opposite Bermondsey Arts Club, 102A Tower Bridge Road SE1 4TP is being used by skateboarders regularly. I called the Police on Sunday and when they arrived at tht scene they confirmed that this constitutes antisocial behaviour which results in damage to the bench. Having spoken to many local residents, we would all be grateful if this bench was removed or relocated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous junction, 15th December
item.description:
Junction too dangerous to cycle down since one way system changed as cars dont look for cyclists as they turn onto elderfield. Potential serious traffic accident waiting to happen
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elderfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drivers driving on the right hand side of the road to avoid bollard, 15th December
item.description:
In Quebec Way there are 2 bollards / posts installed to narrow the road and force driver to slow down near the primary school. Recently one bollard was removed, hole filled up. Subsequently Drivers use the side without the bollard despite the fact that they DRIVE ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE ROAD, which is a driving offence. Also since, drivers do NOT adhere to the 20 miles/hour! Must to fast. Dangerous for all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
